summary: This is a court order from Judge Alison J. Nathan regarding sealed letter requests filed by Ghislaine Maxwell. The order directs the Government to respond to Maxwell's November 25, 2020 letter and her proposed redactions by December 2, 2020, while the letters remain temporarily sealed.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant in the criminal case who filed sealed letter requests to the court.

persons.name: Alison J. Nathan
persons.context: The United States District Judge who issued the order regarding the handling of Maxwell's sealed letter requests.

connections.description: Judge Nathan is presiding over the criminal case against defendant Ghislaine Maxwell.

events.title: Maxwell Files Sealed Letter Request
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell filed a letter request under seal with the court.

events.title: Maxwell Files Second Letter with Redaction Proposal
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell filed a second letter request proposing redactions for both of her sealed letters.

events.title: Court Order Issued
events.description: Judge Alison J. Nathan issued an order requiring the Government to respond to Maxwell's letters and redaction requests by December 2, 2020.

locations: United States District Court Southern District of New York
keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell filed at least two sealed letter requests with the court in late November 2020.
Maxwell proposed specific redactions for these sealed letters, indicating sensitive content.
Judge Alison J. Nathan ordered the Government to respond to Maxwell's requests by December 2, 2020.
The letters were to remain temporarily sealed while the court resolved the redaction issues.
This document shows ongoing legal maneuvering and protective measures in Maxwell's criminal case.
